page.title: 06Sheep Farming at Manor Farm
page.content: In October the farmer buys the ewes from Kendal Market in the Lake District. They are four years old when he buys them. The name of the ewes is Rough Fell and the rams are Blue Faced Leicesters, so the lambs are a cross. In May, at lambing time, the farmer has to check the sheep five times every day, in case a sheep is having trouble lambing. This year they have 230 lambs but there are still some more lambs to be born. In June they have to shear the sheep. They mark the sheep with a blue stripe on the shoulder. The farmer keeps the sheep until they are about 8 years old.
